title: mod or original
txt_content:

在下面评论一下吧！{:10_512:}

replies.author: cyqsimon
replies.txt_content:
56066080 发表于 2014-1-2 20:20 
Your English is better than me? You don't say!
*Your English is better than MINE*

"Your English" acts as the subject in this case. The verb IS is transitive, which directly relates the object to the subject. The object should match the grammatical format of the subject. MINE is a pronoun substitute of MY ENGLISH, therefore is a more appropriate word to use than the word ME.

如果卤蛋看到了不要爆发性吐槽啊，close grammatical analysis 我一般是抱着语法书做的......
